summary: Elizabeth L. Berning was an employee of the Select Committee on Assassinations (SCAS). She is listed in payroll and certification reports from April 1978 to December 1978. These documents provide her name, and in some cases, her annual salary and gross pay during the specified periods. The documents do not specify her exact role within the committee, but her presence on payroll and certification reports indicates she was a staff member.
significance: Elizabeth L. Berning's significance lies in her employment with the Select Committee on Assassinations, indicating her involvement in the investigation, though her specific role is not detailed in these documents.
